comment: Loved having her as a teacher. Very responsive when something was unclear to me.

Grading criteria unclear, no leniency for any emergencies, very strict. Schedule changes, but she does not update any information on D2L, rubrics and requirements hidden or missing, forces assignments and requirements that do not fit project or at absurd deadlines.

Professor Hetzel is super inspirational, a great speaker, and genuinely helpful. We had weekly participation grades, attendance grades, and a few major writing assignments. The main point of the class was a ~2k word research paper about a subject you chose and a short presentation! She brought in guest speakers and the class was generally fun!

She is very straight forward, in my case she was experimenting with how to run English 1102. At first it was a little confusing to me, but then I frequently asked her questions to clear up confusion. And it turned out to be one of the most fun and interesting English classes that I have taken. I would recommend that you do not push off assignments.

This class was pretty easy. You choose one topic and you carry it out till the end of the semester. One thing I like about Professor Hetzel is that she is very accessible outside of class and she does provide extra help during office hours so that's nice. I totally recommend her class.

The best English teacher you will ever have. The coursework is basically writing a research paper over the course of the semester. We have a small discussion/assignment almost every week that is related to our research topic or grammar/spelling. She is very nice, understanding, and will support your research. Many extra credit opportunities.

Prof. Hetzel is a really nice and energetic person and it makes lectures pretty bearable! However, she is pretty confusing as a professor. Our topic for the semester was already a bit hard to understand and she never gave timely feedback. She used AI for examples and encouraged us to use it for our artifact?? Which is odd for a English professor.

She's a good teacher but get prepared to read in this class only thing I would say is how we would have a new reading every week & discussion & reflection post about it. But she's very lenient just show up and do the work you'll pass

Her class was very enjoyable and informative. She gives great feedback on major assignments. She has such good energy that made me look forward to this class every week. You choose one topic to write about in the beginning of this semester and it carries out till the end. I would absolutely recommend taking her class!

I Believe she's the best English teacher I ever had. If you show up to class do what you're supposed to do you will pass. Lectures are mandatory but knowledgeable. She's very understanding and gives you free will on what to write your essay over as long as it's connected with the topic. I 100 percent recommend taking her class.

one of the best prof i took for english. super sweet and dosent have a difficult class. attendance is mandatory however she makes her class enjoyable and gives you the motive to go. She dosent assign difficult work at all except for one final essay which you will start from the beginning of the semester. i would def recommend taking this class

one of the best prof ive took during spring 2024. shes so caring and very nice. id also say shes pretty funny sometimes and definetly makes it so you can enjoy coming to the lectures even tho they are mandatory. she has work assigned every week but its pretty short and easy. def worth taking her class.

Professor Hetzel is very kind and straightforward. Make sure you participate and take advantage of extra credit! Very helpful and understanding of late work as long as you talk to her. Awesome person and 
I plan to take her world lit.

Professor Hetzel was great. Super fair for an English professor with straightforward rubrics that are actually followed. No surprises. Show up, do the work, and get an A. Would take in the future, for sure!

Pretty easy class. She really wants students to participate in her lectures and you are graded on your participation and whether or not you were prepared. She is really nice, you have 3 major assignments. One of them being a group project, and 2 essays.

Super easy A, everything is graded pass/fail except for 1 research essay that you work on throughout the semester. You only need to do every other discussion post and 1 assignment a week that only takes around 30 minutes max. She doesn't put grades in until the very end. It is a hybrid class so she does grade you showing up the one day of the week.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Hetzel is very understanding and will work with you. I enjoyed her class, and I am currently taking ENGL 1102 and will be taking World Lit in the fall with her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: She is a great professor and gives great feedback on all assignments. Some of the assignment prompts are a little confusing. All of the essays let you be creative and choose the topic. There was a total of three essays. One essay was a collaborative group analysis.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She gives you easy to do essay's that offers a lot of creative freedom on how you write it. She usually allows you to choose what you want to write, which makes it easier for students to get an easy A. Her lectures are pretty helpful in developing your skills as a writer. Offers extra credit. Only complaint is that the discussion posts can be long.

I highly recommend taking her especially if you're coming from high school to college b/c this class helps you adjust. Sometimes when she talks too much about an assignment it can get confusing but she is always open to answering questions and helping. She offers EC and really cares for her students. She gives great feedback and is really sweet.
She is a really nice prof and is straightforward about grading. She is also very helpful and is there for students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed taking her class. She has clear guidelines for every assignment and will answer your emails if you have any questions. It said a textbook was required but I never used it and I never needed it.
Super good teacher, really nice to listen to. Though one bad thing about late work she takes 10 points off

Hetzel is a good professor. I'm not much of a writer, but I did the work and came to class, and I got an A. The papers she assigned let me write about my interests, and she does give feedback. Some partner/group assignments, but not for the papers. It wasn't an easy course, definitely took some time, but I found it to be worth taking.

When I signed up for Hetzels class I was expecting for it to be an easy A. ITS NOT. I can write stellar papers, but shes very knit-picky. Most of her assignments made me roll my eyes, because they were too much. She doesnt offer much freedom to write about what you want compared to other 1102 professors. Little time between papers.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Knowledgeable professor but assignment expectations are not clear and are usually not assigned with an easy to follow rubric. Classes were interesting but she does not offer any forms of remediation for the essays. Additionally, I suggest going to her for help with papers BEFORE they are due, so you are not surprised by not fulfilling requirements.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I myself enjoy literature and analyzing pieces to a certain extent, and this professor is as good as any at facilitating stimulating literary conversation. When it comes to the papers, she constructs effective peer review and one-on-one with herself to aid you on a paper. She is a very intelligent, kind, sweet lady who challenges her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Hetzel is a very amazing teacher. She explains things vividly and helps you really understand assignments/essays. She grades pretty fairly. Her personality is awesome and she keeps the class intrigued. I would def take this class again.

Not that good. Very unspecific and unclear about what she wants from you. She asks you to read a lot but I got away with not reading most of the things. I for sure would not take her again, but she seems to be a bit more understanding the 2nd half of the semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY
